website_summaries.verdict: The most budget-friendly option Eero offers for small homes and apartments.
pros: Individual beacon helps to extend the WiFi range to another level of a home
Eero device automatically updates for better security and speed as improvements roll out
cons: The controlling smartphone app can be slow and limited when monitoring network performance

customer_reviews.title: Their app has in-app purchases!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe you're not the kind of person who gets annoyed at companies repeatedly trying to upsell you onto their crappy subscription Adblocker for ten bucks a month when you open their app. You'll have a better time with Eero than I do.
customer_reviews.author: yliebermann

customer_reviews.title: Avoid eero
customer_reviews.text: I had better coverage with my aging Time Capsule. It’s too late for me to return the device or I would. This is a quote from eero customer support. “One other thing I have noticed that Both eero's are going down at random times through out the past week.” This happens frequently and it’s annoying and they can’t offer any further suggestion. Also the eero can’t handle one AppleTV streaming and it doesn’t like when there are multiple devices streaming at once. I have a 200mb cable modem the tracks from 190 to 205 regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Blainey

customer_reviews.title: A wifi sysrem that picks and chooses who you use for email.. guess this is China!
customer_reviews.text: After Spectrum finally came to our house and figured out why our service was so horrible ( still not good ) the tech suggested getting a faster wifi router, he even mentioned this one by eero. After it arrived and I installed I was more than ticked that it doesn't allow me to use my old CompuServe account, the manufacturer has arbitrarily decided what email service it will allow and not allow, after weeks of responding to the pop up windows from eero to alert their tech support about denied access to CompuServe, I haves received no response from their tech..... WE ARE NOT A COMMUNIST STATE YET!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Great network when it works. Beware of outages.
customer_reviews.text: When the Eero Pro is happy all is excellent in the world. It is a much better router than the AT&T Uverse wirless network. Set up is relatively easy. That said, pray that you never have a power or internet outage. Each time, be prepared to spend hours with a fussy Eero establishing connection. In the few weeks that we have had the network, we have had this headache 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: 99 LifeStories

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power in such a small device
customer_reviews.text: Never having used, or even heard of, a mesh WiFi router, I wanted to give this little wonder a try. My Spectrum wireless WiFi was always cutting out and not reliable, don't get me wrong, it would give me 5G speed but only when IT wanted to. I looked into eero, read up on all the reviews and even searched a way to piggyback the system with Spectrum. (This bridging thing and having to try to contact a living person at Spectrum gave me the willies) So the setup was amazingly easy, no conflicts with having eero as my 2nd router. And its ALWAYS sending a signal....And the connection is spot on fast... Wow I love this little box
customer_reviews.author: R. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: If You Are Looking to Boost Your Speed ...
customer_reviews.text: DON'T. This is for coverage only. The base station (eero pro) senses and receives almost 1GB speed, but transfers only 200-250Mb. I get better speeds with my WiFi card and the Xfinity box natively. I even tested sitting right next to the unit and the WiFi speed was just as poor. I might have been misunderstood by thinking that this unit boosts coverage and WiFi speed. It does not. Do not purchase this setup if you are looking for a speed boost as you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Reza Molavi

customer_reviews.title: the only WiFi system really suitable for non-techie users
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of WiFi hardware over the years, and this is the only system I would recommend to non-techie users. It's the best-designed hardware-software package I've ever used (and I used to write reviews for publications such as PC World and CNET). When I bought it a month ago, it was also the only consumer-level system that had already been patched against Krack exploits. For technical users, the advanced management tools in the Android app are much faster and easier to use than the typical setup screens for consumer-oriented devices from Netgear, D-Link, and Apple. For example, reserving an IP address for a currently connected device takes just a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Lauriston

customer_reviews.title: Completely lacks support for network-level VPNs
customer_reviews.text: While this product is sleekly designed, I am incredibly disappointed that such a seemingly sophisticated (and expensive) distributed WiFi setup completely lacks VPN support at the network-level (i.e., router-level VPN support). This feature is important for the safety and privacy of Eero’s users; however, after speaking with Eero about this, it seems that while router-level VPN support has been considered, this important feature is seemingly nowhere close to shipping. I had expected better from such a relatively high-end and — purportedly — cutting-edge WiFi company. Eero, please update your routers to support this essential feature to protect the safety and privacy of your users.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because it was suppose to be fantastic; however, after having it installed and troubleshooting for HOURS with spectrum and research.......our Eeros are the problem!! They randomly cut out so you you lose EVERYTHING!! I've lost cricut projects (which aren't cheap), important phone calls and most importantly, my kids have been disconnected in the middle of school zooms. I'm over this product. Save your money and buy something else. Also, they get really, really hot. Like, scary hot.
customer_reviews.author: 3MonsterMom

customer_reviews.title: Product works great.
customer_reviews.text: Did not buy a product that works great to be solicited to buy a monthly service to monitor my WiFi. Love the product and works great but if I get any more e-mails saying I have to buy security I may have to send back and buy something like my Apple airport that I never had any issues and was never contacted to buy security from Apple or a third party.
customer_reviews.author: Rb

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT, TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: The product works great, tech. support -GREAT! Try to get someone from billing or customer service on the phone??? FORGET IT! 47 minutes on hold without speaking to anyone? Plus the pricing seems to change daily. Something is screwed up at this company.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Lacking Two Significant Features
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Amazon review. That's how deeply I regret purchasing my eero. A quick peek at their community forum will show a bunch of posts from eero with "no plans to implement this feature" responses". With that being said, while the product performs well the customization of the network lacks two substantial features: 1) The ability to port forward ranges 2) The ability to turn off wifi bands selectively. If these are not a consideration for you then you should be ok but if you need the ability to customize your network with these two somewhat popular features look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Aronson

customer_reviews.title: Slow speeds and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the router for a little more than a month and am pretty disappointed with the reliability and incredibly slow speeds. It is incapable of streaming 4K movies from my AppleTV and it ALWAYS loses connection, even though my router is 10 feet away from the AppleTV. I can't return it because its been 45 days, so I will have to sell it online somewhere. THE WORST!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Kotler

customer_reviews.title: I'm on the EERO Pro band wagon.
customer_reviews.text: After spending {way too much} money on the Linksys AC5400 and then the Netscape Night Hawk and getting poor performance and awful tech support I discovered the EERO Pro. My previous overpriced routers (fishing anchors) both experienced spotty coverage and daily loss of the 5 ghz signal necessitating a reboot. Both tech support experiences were not good. This EERO Pro mesh system has been rock solid with nary a dropped signal and strong WiFi presence all through the house and around the outside too. GO ERRO !! I can't say anything about the tech support because I haven't needed any! It's just been chugging along handling all my many devices without a hiccup. What else could one want?
customer_reviews.author: bobk

customer_reviews.title: Overheating!
customer_reviews.text: The units were SO hot, and it did not over performed as was expected it would.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Beacon plug broke - and support is non existent
customer_reviews.text: The devices are under 1 year warranty and I am not getting anywhere with a beacon replacement. The plug broke - I don't even know how 1 piece of the plug pop out of the slot... it's held by plastic. Emailed support@eero.com 3 - THREE TIMES - not a ticket response. I followed up and nothing... no response but an automated one... ONCE. Tried calling the support line... and I was waiting for 30 min ... not even a queue time to warn me how long I am going to be on hold... I don't even know if the lines are manned. Terrible Terrible Support... NON EXISTENT
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Dump your router, and get an Eero!
customer_reviews.text: Eero is so much more than a router. The set-up is amazing, the speed for all of our connections in the house is crazy-fast, and the app on the phone is really useful. I have all of the control of devices that I was wanting, and the mesh means we don't have dead spots in the house. I was worried that I would need two beacons, but one is perfectly fine for our house (1 story, 1,400 sf). I work from home, but I can video chat while the wife watches Amazon Prime and my son plays PlayStation, and we have no hiccups at all.
customer_reviews.author: J Scott Self

customer_reviews.title: Improvement over Apple airport
customer_reviews.text: After many weeks of reading reviews I decided to try the eero mesh system. At first I was underwhelmed and I don't think the range is greatly improved compared to my old, but reliable Apple airport wifi network. However, my Tesla model 3 can now connect to my wifi signal which was an issue before mesh. My electric car has over air updates at least monthly. So, overall I am satisfied the new app interface plus the car connection justify my change to newer technology. My Apple network was remarkably stable, so long term this will be a question for the eero system.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Signal is not strong enough to play my Sonos system
customer_reviews.text: I had been using an Apple Airport and decided it was time to upgrade. I read about eero and it sounded good for what I needed...nothing too complicated. It arrived, I set it up, converted all devices, including Sonos to the new wi-fi. Then I started to try to ply Apple Music through Sonos and I kept getting “Unable to Connect”. After a few days of frustration I reconnected my old Apple and have great connections all through the house...moral...if your old devices work satisfactorily don’t change to something supposedly better...
customer_reviews.author: Randy Fields

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set-Up
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace our old router with one that would reach the entire house and support a growing number of devices. The set-up was ridiculously simple: download the app, plug the router in, then add your devices. I bought one Beacon to strengthen the signal upstairs. Everything has been working perfectly, including adding additional devices whenever. I love that the Eero Pro is compact and self-contained. My old router was good for its time, but the various antennae sticking out on top were always falling over and were hard to keep clean. The Eero is small, simple and easy to keep clean. No problems at all after a month.
customer_reviews.author: MossRose

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality, very fast speed.
customer_reviews.text: I had actually bought another (cheaper) mesh system, but had to return it because it was in reliable and felt cheaply made. This system was a bit more expensive, but in the long run, it was worth it. I really haven’t had any real problems with it. I did have one question for their support, and it took 12 days for them to even contact me back. By then, the problem had resolved itself...but their answer wasn’t exactly top notch. I’m happy with this purchase, and would recommend...but don’t count on support getting back to you quickly during this crazy time we’re going through.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: That it worked for two days
customer_reviews.text: I had to unplug the two units because they both overheated so badly I thought it would cause a fire. I do not recommend this product at all. All they wanted me to do was purchase their security system for my computer. When I told them that they overheated and I was frightened they never got back to me. DO not purchase. I subsequently purchased SETEK extender which works perfectly and is much cheaper by far. I didn't even have to call tech support to set it up. It was just that easy. EERO wants to get into the guts of your computer and take it over.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Better WiFi now that we are working from home
customer_reviews.text: Huge difference with our WiFi experience. Now with 3 of us working from home during the shelter at home protocols, we are all have better and faster WiFi. Streaming is a bunch better too. Easy to install. Shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: BT10IS

customer_reviews.title: Best tech upgrade in recent memory
customer_reviews.text: My old Airport Extreme Base Station took a dump and I eventually settled on EERO as a replacement wifi system. Best decision I've made in a long time. Set up was a breeze, my internet connection has been strong and remarkably stable, and the app is fantastic. Two additional simple features make this system even better—1) the "on" light on the Pro Base unit and the Beacon tells you exactly what the state of your internet connection is and 2) the night light on the Beacon is just one of those thoughtful features that makes you appreciate smart design. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Burton

customer_reviews.title: WiFi for dazzzzzzzzzzze.
customer_reviews.text: This attractive little bundle solved all of my connectivity issues. I love it and have recommended it to all of my colleagues. The app is great, but initial set up can get hung up with no apparent next steps if there is any sort of issue. Ended up having to contact my ISP and they solved the problem. Since then: smooth and reliable wifi like I have never experienced before.
customer_reviews.author: carlosthepony

customer_reviews.title: Well above expectations
customer_reviews.text: I assumed this would be better than what I had (a wireless router and an extender) and it is better; way faster and way better range, but also, a breeze to set up. The Beacon was dead on arrival however, but I am not taking points away for that, mostly because the tech support was very good and quickly replaced it without issue and little effort on my part. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Abney

customer_reviews.title: It. Just. Works.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it on the advice of a satisfied user and have no regrets. It was quick (less than 10 minutes) and easy (no mis-steps) to install with the iPhone interface. Base station and one extra covers a large two-story rambling old farmhouse and both the front and back sitting areas. I have not had to reset it or fiddle with it after power outages - it just comes back on. (Not like Spectrum, arrrrghhh!) I can't comment on support because I have not needed any.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H. Elias

customer_reviews.title: Worked in my 1700sf Cape
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect, but knowing I could return it if I wasn't happy, I gave it a shot. It works great! Not only fixed my dead zones, but seemed to make my wifi faster? Don't know how, but I'll take it. I did have a slight problem with where to put the Beacon and emailed support only to never hear from them. But I finally found a spot that worked for it and ended up not needing support. Other than the beacon issue, very easy to install and does what it claims especially in my cape cod style house that has some weird rooms.
customer_reviews.author: recoveringshopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Finally have reliable wifi
customer_reviews.text: I have been through multiple wifi routers over the years, trying to get reliable connectivity in my house, where my neighbors signal often seemed to interfere. In the past, even the Cisco "high performance gaming router" had trouble overcoming my neighbors. Even with max strength, facetime calls, or browsing from my phones would be slow, or pixelated. The eero finally seems to provide smart signalling that allows for fast connectivity. The user interface on the phone couldnt be easier to setup, and monitor, a very clean and intuitive design
customer_reviews.author: Pantherfan69

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Easiest computer peripheral that I have ever installed. Total plug and play. The device found the internet, found the extender/beacon with no problem (it has a night light, neat little addition), connected to the phones, network computers, printers, etc. Updated automatically. Only thing is that I needed to install an inexpensive switch as my prior WIFI modem had several outlets. Did not use tech support so cannot rate it. Range is great and throughput is fantastic (we have local City provided fiber).
customer_reviews.author: A. Mouton

customer_reviews.title: Good mesh system EEro pro+ beacon
customer_reviews.text: Eero Pro mesh WiFi system (1 Pro + 1 Beacon). Install it for a 1400 sq. ft house. This system covers all areas inside the house pretty well and also in the back and front yard. Beacon is a simple device you just plug in the wall outlet. Pro is supposed to be on table top. It has one port if you want hard wire one computer or to have an extender at that point to connect as many ports as you want. I have my house all wireless with one computer at the Pro. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ryazanov

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as described.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work - spent hours trying to set up. Have another one that works so this one must be defective - and Amazon no help ...
customer_reviews.author: Bythefly

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Mesh System to Install
customer_reviews.text: I've installed a lot of routers, switches and modems in my time. I must say Eero's smartphone app made the installation process super easy to get my home wireless network up and running throughout my entire home within 5 minutes. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: South Bay Twins Dad

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: At first I had some problems connecting my printer wirelessly and I had to “scrub” the HP and eero support communities for help. But, I finally made it work. Also, I wasn’t use to my desktop connecting completely wirelessly (I have the Hue hub using the only available port on the eero). However, after everything was resolved, I have to say I’m very please with the eero — it’s simplicity and functionality. It just works.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2 bedroom apartment on our property separate from the main house and it's always had spotty wifi: looked at various options and decided to give eero a try based on the positive reviews. Set up a mesh with 2 Pros and 2 Beacons to cover both house and apartment and (after getting some excellent phone support from eero) had everything running in under an hour. Works flawlessly with negligible loss of bandwith from the router to the furthest Beacon. Outstanding Product!!
customer_reviews.author: ELX

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up with Mac + Verizon Fios
customer_reviews.text: I found this very easy to set up with Verizon Fios. But you need to run the ethernet cable from the Fios router to your Eero base station, not the Modem to the eero. I also had a legacy airport extreme with USB to a printer. I kept that and put the airport extreme on client mode (instructions are on Eero web site) and that worked well. Then I linked up all my other devices (TV, sonos etc) to the new network and everything worked. We have a three-story row house and found that one Pro with the one Beacon did the trick. I thought I might need two beacons but did not.
customer_reviews.author: SFrom

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, and the app is awesome. I don't understand the complaints from some of the nerds on here, but for a basic home WiFi set up it's hard to imagine a better solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SOLID GOLD .. You won’t regret it
customer_reviews.text: This whole system is DA BOMB . My Amazon Firestick has been lagging more and more and then I realized My Apple Airport had stop being supported by Apple so I got these on a whim and It has worked AWESOME. MY WHOLE HOUSE AND I JUST BOUGHT A BEACON FOR MY GARAGE. The interface via the app is so easy and I can jam my Amazon Music in my garage as I type this review out. Thanks for this gem.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't have been easier
customer_reviews.text: When my Apple Airport stopped working I looked into what was recommended for Apple products and Eero came up on multiple reviews. I bought one Eero with one beacon, as I live in an apartment and don't need to cover that much area. The entire set up process from box to fully functional took less than 10 minutes including the printer. In addition it looks like an apple product and less like a traditional router.
customer_reviews.author: WtrBby

customer_reviews.title: A lot of money for 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: When this was first installed it worked pretty good. Gradually it started losing its wifi strength. Not long after that the plug in extension stopped working. Return window was only 30 days. For the price I thought it would work much longer.
customer_reviews.author: P. Patty

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi Connectivity Problem Solver
customer_reviews.text: My Samsung 4G smart TV would frequently buffer when I tried to watch 4G content. Since replacing the cable company's router with eero the only time my TV has buffered is when the cable company itself was having issues. Not only that but my Internet download and upload speeds noticeably increased. This was one of the rare products whose setup was as easy as the marketing suggested it would be. So eero was a little expensive but it turned out to be well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Quick Set-up, strong WiFi throughout
customer_reviews.text: I am of average capability when it comes to tech - general knowledge of how basic tech works, a moderate user of tech, and capable of following directions. This system was incredibly quick and easy to set up; also made switching my existing Echo, dots, smart plugs, etc relatively simple. So far, I am very happy with my Eero Pro! We have a 2500 square foot house, single floor, and the bedrooms often had spotty coverage due to a more remote location from our cable-based modem set-up. We now have a strong signal throughout the entire house, as well as on our back patio and garage.
customer_reviews.author: AliGroom

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We needed to upgrade our WiFi system because we had noticed that our connectivity was always buffering. We came off of the Apple AirPort and we purchased the Eero with an extra beacon. We no longer have connectivity issues and this was by far the simplest set up ever. Highly recommended and no glitches so far!
customer_reviews.author: K R

customer_reviews.title: Sadly bricked on me within 6 hours
customer_reviews.text: Install and setup were a breeze. Within 6 hours the unit tried to do a firmware update and bricked. Nothing can be done by tech or user to fix or restart the device. Only option is get a new one and wait 3-5 days...
customer_reviews.author: D. Otto

customer_reviews.title: Best Router Yet!
customer_reviews.text: I love the easy set up. It literally took minutes to set it up. Just the two piece set up covered our entire home (1800 SQ FT). I've yet to have a dropped or low signal anywhere in the house. We have several devices on ata time without fluctuation of signal strength. Our internet speed is 100MBPS download and 10 up. So far the eero averages 115 down and 11 up, which is beyond satisfactory. I don't really use the app much, but it did make the setup a breeze and it's nice to be able to check the usage. I have already recommended it to numerous family and friends without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeTime

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work at our house at all. Amazon will not process a refund for me since it’s been 30 days so now I’m out $300 for a system that doesn’t benefit me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It just works... fast and easy access
customer_reviews.text: After a year, still love eero. Great coverage with multiple devices at same time in 4 bedroom home. Love ad blocker. Control of kid’s access liked by parents! It just works. Never have to reset. Spoiled with such a great system at home compared to work. This is one less thing to worry about or get complaints about. In past year only time I heard “WiFi not working” was during power outage. Just be aware certain advanced features are $10 a month but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: It's Me (really)

customer_reviews.title: Looks like the complaints seem to be mostly for power users
customer_reviews.text: For 2 years, my roommates and I struggled with configuring our internet to be faster than 10mbps with a pair of Medialink routers. We have 100mbps from Comcast. Installed and updated the Eero system in <30 minutes (most of the time was auto-updating). Now we have 50mbps+ throughout our 2k sq ft house, and ~100mbps closer to the beacon/router. While the product isn't cheap, it's worth avoiding the headache of not having properly working wifi. Looks like the complaints seem to be mostly for power users, but for the everyday person, I think this product rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Sandesh Shettar

customer_reviews.title: and I couldn’t be happier. I live in a tiny house
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for 3 months now, and I couldn’t be happier. I live in a tiny house, but for some reason being 20 ft away from the router would cause a major slowdown. It was impossible to stream from my computer to my TV, constantly reloading and waiting. I tried switching internet providers 3 times and never improved the speed. The eero has changed all of that. I have one eero upstairs, one downstairs. They both cover 500 square feet, and now we can stream anywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy Setup
customer_reviews.text: We have had numerous routers for our B&B here in Costa Rica and they are difficult to reprogram and keep needing rebooting. This system was set up in minutes, and with my phone I was able to complete the setup, set a password and was up and running. To this point, there have been no issues from people saying with us. In the past they would mention not being able to connect. So, I would reboot. Now with Eero, there has been no issues. Love the system.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Balch

customer_reviews.title: Not possible to create pure 5g network with eero
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. Bought 5 eeros and It is impossible to create a pure 5g network which in my case prevents me from getting the high speed i hire from the isp. Feedback already given to customer service but they do not know when eero will have this feature available. Really frustrating customer service and configuration. Do not buy if you want to enjoy 5g speed.
customer_reviews.author: RHCP

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed about how easy this was to set up. First you get the eero app on your phone. Then the app will walk you through the set up. I am 74 years old and not tech savvy and was able to connect my wireless printer, smart tv and other device using the base unit and one beacon. I have a Mac computer and it is compatible. I had a little trouble trying to figure out where to make the network change on my computer but my grandson quickly found it and I almost felt stupid because it was so easy!
customer_reviews.author: GeorgiaBabe

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and does really help with whole house internet
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of setup and performance of this device. With my husband and myself working from home and I needed consistent and high speed for both of us (upstairs and downstairs). It creates its own network - I even attached our fridge that has WiFi to it - and it consistently is seamless. Unlike our ISP! :)
customer_reviews.author: emm

customer_reviews.title: Bought to replace Netgear Nighthawk! - great solution
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to setup and create the mesh network. The application was simple to use and within 10 mins had my whole network setup. Great performance and signed up to use eero +. It has already blocked within the 1st week 3 malware attacks to my iPad (go figure) as well as blocked over 10k ads (multiple devices), all in 1 week. I bought this to replace a brand new Netgear Nighthawk router I had for only for 3 weeks. Kept getting slow internet connectivity, devices being dropped. After dealing with Netgear support I just gave up. My wife especially likes the night light that is on the eero Beacon. Just a win win to purchase this product!
customer_reviews.author: CRICH-10

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: These are replacing an AirPort Extreme and an AirPort Express in small condo where there was lots of interference from neighbors' WiFi. At first, the AirPorts worked very well. Eventually though, my neighbors seem to have upgraded their hardware and my Apple devices couldn't keep up. I was having more and more trouble getting signal in the room farthest from my router. The Eero Pro system has solved this problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: great wi fi routers
customer_reviews.text: This system is easy to install, and Amazon was far less than Direct TV, just plug it in and it does all the work. I was getting 13mps from my Netgear and I now get 130mps all through the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WiFi signal strength is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Eero was easy to set up and connected easily to our modem. We live in a condo with lots of angles and various walls made of metal, wood and concrete and an office away from the entry point for the signal. The product is excellent and delivered as promised. We have a single node between the router and office and upload and download speeds are extraordinary. Video conferencing is exceptional quality and no garbled sound or out of focus imagery. Will get another node for the balance of our IoT devices. Awesome!! 5 Star rating!
customer_reviews.author: PTMOM

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. We have about 20 devices that connect to our WiFi network, including a doorbell, camera, TiVo, and all our iPhones iPads and laptops. Setup was easy in the app, the main unit is in the living room and the plug in unit is upstairs in the bedroom. Speeds are faster that our old router, and Apple TimeCapsule. Great coverage across our 1900 square feet house. I like the app. It allows you to see each device connected, and easily see info about each, including if it’s idle or sending/receiving data, and you can easily block the device. You can also assign devices to a person, and then pause all of them (great for blocking kiddos)
customer_reviews.author: Joe DeMasi

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and use. My original Verizon (now Frontier) router was located in an upstairs bedroom. I have a 2-story, 1650 sq foot house. I could not get reliable wireless coverage in the master bedroom located downstairs and on the other side of the house. I ordered my Eero system and had it up and running in less than 20 minutes. I located the beacon in the dining room directly below the bedroom with the router. I now have outstanding, fast, wifi coverage throughout my house! I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: asportsfreak

customer_reviews.title: Great Wi-Fi Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my aged and fritzing AirPort Extreme, and also to eliminate the use of the low end router supplied by Frontier. The Eero signal is strong throughout the house, and there are no stuttering dropouts. My only problem is that my house is too small to use the Eero Beacon 😞. Otherwise, highly recommended, Setup on the iOS app is almost as easy as Apple AirPort Utility.
customer_reviews.author: Ericjp

customer_reviews.title: Good for standard use, but not many advance features or web portal capability.
customer_reviews.text: If your'e looking for a simple mesh system for your home it's a good buy. Simple to set-up, and decent user controls with SOME advance features. The only reason I'm returning the product is they do not allow the user to access the router outside the mobile-app. Meaning no Dynamic DNS addressing, or advance user functions that would normally be available in a web interface.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Best home wifi router
customer_reviews.text: Wow! we used to have the apple wifi router. airport express. And constantly had connectivity issues and spotty connection in different corners of our apartment. With Eero's two pack solution we have good coverage everywhere. Also, I believe the airport express router (and many other routers) can reliably only handle ~20 devices connected. With Eero we are 30+ devices and haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Radical improvement
customer_reviews.text: Airport express, no matter how configured, could not adequately extend WiFi from Apple router to completely Or strongly cover my home’s interior and exterior. Rock solid, every square inch, within ten minutes of unboxing,With this product however. Completely satisfied. Thrilled, even. Just one Pro, and one beacon are delivering strong, fast signal everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hill

customer_reviews.title: More WiFi Area, but worse downloads
customer_reviews.text: Provided more WiFi area but didn’t allow for downloads. Called tech multiple times. Not given a solution. Needed to switch back to Linksys to download then eero got get better range. The Eero is Not the system that will work for us.
customer_reviews.author: V Raber

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi system Updated: With a horrible App.
customer_reviews.text: Updated: New app is pretty terrible, they removed key data elements from the already limit app data (impossible to figure out what is going on with your network). The hardware is good, the app is terrible. Added a wired AP and beacon to my Eero network. I love the set it and forget it implementation. Solves all my home wifi issues and easy to administer.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: My WiFi is still having issues
customer_reviews.text: I seem to be having more WiFi issues than with my previous router. I’m not sure if this is a problem with the router, or due to the increased internet usage due to the COVID-19 issues. I'll probably give their tech support, which is excellent, and see what they say.
customer_reviews.author: George Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Totally painless
customer_reviews.text: Am covering a 1200+ sf condo with one base + one beacon. Among the most painless technology purchases I’ve ever made in my 25-ish year tech life so far. Delivers promised speeds, is easy to share a login with guests, and I go weeks without thinking about it at all. Superb.
customer_reviews.author: pianophile

customer_reviews.title: Total bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Albeit a bit expensive, it is totally worth the price I paid. Our home has a difficult time with our WiFi, so I bought the Eero to assist in getting the signal throughout those. Add the ability to see who’s connected your service is awesome. I haven’t tried to restrict data, but that’s my next plan.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Works great and great support and ongoing simple automatic updates
customer_reviews.text: My erros have worked perfectly. When I did ring customer support (once), support was amazingly 5-star plus. The eeros also keep themselves updated automatically making home use extremely simple and covers my entire house including the yard too.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous internet speed/coverage
customer_reviews.text: My first Eero system was purchased for additional coverage of WiFi in a rambling one story vacation house. Second system for our primary residence for speed and coverage. This was for our new vacation home which has lots of funny angles and space. Easy to install and use - the app makes it all straightforward. I had a technical problem with one installation due to our particular internet service provider. Tech support was easy to contact, knowledgeable, and walked me through my issue with a perfect resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Donn A. Randall

customer_reviews.title: You wont regret it!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I decided to invest in a new wi-fi router when i changed internet providers, and WOW! Easiest set-up and great signal strength not only, throughout my house, but well out into my yard! I have about a 1800 sq. foot home , and ordered the base unit with one beacon and it very much exceeds all expectations. I HIGHLY reccomend this system!
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Software only handles the common cases
customer_reviews.text: Unless your use is the common case (simple wifi devices like laptops and phones, and a stable internet connection), you should look elsewhere. Setup is also glitchy; my phone need 2 - 3 tries to successfully connect the first time. Once set up, it's mostly stable. Although the internal network doesn't function if the external internet is down (I couldn't cast a downloaded movie).
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Wifi strength
customer_reviews.text: I have a multi level home made of brick and I think gofer would from Noah's arc. Main router in bedroom and the other in dining room on first level. Wifi signal is great in the basement and also in backyard. No more disconnects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hello Eero !
customer_reviews.text: Hello Eero !, I was using the router option of my surfboard modem and barely getting an speed of 10-20 Mbps, since a change to eero I am having a very strong WiFi signal Around my whole house a reaching speeds of 150-200 Mbps and the integration of this product with my ring security and cameras systems, amazon devices is flawless. I strongly recommend this product !
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Unparalleled Product
customer_reviews.text: I love my eero. It's great value for your money and the control it gives you over your next work is unbelievably convenient and second to none in my experience. Anybody who rents a router from their internet provider needs to stop burning money and purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: T. Soprano

customer_reviews.title: Smart Phone IS required for setup!!
customer_reviews.text: The only drawbacks I've had were with setup. A smart phone is required but no mention was made of this before purchase. Also, setting up the beacon was misleading. After setting it up, the program went into a loop for setting the beacon up. Once the beacon is set, it's set..regardless what the program said. NO instructions in the box. Just a phone number and a website. Packaging was excellent and, aside from the above issues, has exceeded my expectations. I went from losing service going to the other end of the house to being able to get service at my neighbor's house!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D.

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years of WiFi Bliss
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Eero mesh network router three years ago today, and haven't regretted it once. We have the Eero Pro with one beacon in our larger home, and there are no dead spots, no slow zones, just fast connections everywhere, even with 15+ devices simultaneously connected.
customer_reviews.author: David Frandsen

customer_reviews.title: Loss of connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Although the Eero works-do connection coming off the primary Eero is good, the devices connected to the secondary Eero lose connection. This is okay if you are just an internet browser, but for those doing more than just browsing the internet beware.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena D.

customer_reviews.title: This is the Tesla of Routers
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. I had a Netgear modem-router combo, which i setup in bridge mode and eero app walked me throught the installation steps. It literally took me 3 minutes to setup eero pro and beacon. It works like a champ. I was so frustrated with my wifi dropping and eero solved my problems. Initially i was reluctant on spending the money, but after using it for a day this is definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Chinmay Tembe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome connection from anywhere and helpful app
customer_reviews.text: Have totally wiped out any wifi dead zones in my place. Awesome connection from anywhere and helpful app. I've heard people say they run hot - mine do a bit but it doesn't seem problematic. The base is around 120F and the beacon is around 105-110F using a laser thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: q

customer_reviews.title: Very good with minor glitches.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for about a month and it's been very good. Had to reset it twice when my iPad would not load anything on the internet despite it having full bars and the modem was fully functioning but it's extended to parts of my house that never had wifi and it's fast in every part of the house now.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Morris

customer_reviews.title: Got same speed as ATT!
customer_reviews.text: Yes easy to install but did not get pass 18 in speed!
customer_reviews.author: beamer

customer_reviews.title: Wow, that was easy
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from Airport Time Cap, tried and failed to get new Nighthawk to stop dropping signals. The Eero has a small footprint, very easy iPhone App to setup the system and connected without any problems. Been running for 120+ days and not 1 dropped connection or spinning delays. All devices seem to be happy. Used my prime rewards to make it seem the same price as others, but when I now know it was worth it. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Legg-Va

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Works so much better then the crappy one you have to use from the cable providers. This one has a large reach with it's beacon so that I can be on the same network anywhere in my house and not have to change passwords. Love it. Super fast.
customer_reviews.author: NN

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works
customer_reviews.text: I have up to 600 mbsp internet speed but WiFi was only getting up to 5-20 mbsp. It’s around 100-300 with eero so I can actually work from home without needing to hardwire in!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wi if system and has definitely increased our signal strength. I haven’t had to use tech support but the app is clear and easy to use. Set up was a breeze and up and running in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: Trouble free WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Very good set up in 15 minutes super easy. Coverage is excellent. Best WiFi I have had here. Paying for 200 Mbps and getting 240 Mbps on the wireless connection not direct wired. Do far so good. We have 10 items connected. Set and forget. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: bacobits

customer_reviews.title: Glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: All my devices benefited from the increased signal strength throughout the house.I am not very tech savy, but found set up easy enough to try on your own. You might want to watch the set up on u tube prior to starting. Had a problem syncing my wireless laser printer, but that was the printer not the Erro.
customer_reviews.author: AMG

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic WiFi System - Recommend it with an A+++
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router product available. I have used others before, and eero has created a product that is excellent, efficient, provides high capacity WiFi and even provides light in a dark hallway (when needed)... Can't recommend this product highly enough! Thank you, eero Team WiFi System Team!
customer_reviews.author: Nina K

customer_reviews.title: Replacing Eero with Google mesh wifi route which delivers a consistent 700 megabits and runs very cool in comparison
customer_reviews.text: Eero listing claimed the it was giga speed, not true. Upgraded to gig service but eero could only deliver 300 megabits. Cox tech tested speed from cable modem at a little over one gig into the Eero. The bigger problem is the system quit working after only 9 months of service. Noticed the Eero base is running very very hot. Replacing Eero with Google mesh wifi route which delivers a consistent 700 megabits and runs very cool in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Mike  DHaem

customer_reviews.title: A noticeable difference and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: In my house, this works so much better than the Orbi, and after two weeks it's still doing it's job. My partner hadn't noticed any issue (reach or lag) with our home wifi but did notice the difference after the eero was up and running. And it was truly easy to set up. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A

customer_reviews.title: Effective Mesh System
customer_reviews.text: Had the box ripped open and on the network within 15 minutes. Its as simple as brushing your teeth. Accurate, sleek and most of all has a great performance level.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My old modem and router were outdated and slow (25mbps). I got this and a new modem and my speeds have increased to 153mbps! Super easy to set up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kate R.

customer_reviews.title: Great setup for those who want WiFi that just works!
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing upgrade for our home WiFi. The only thing missing is a USB port to do light file serving. I've been so used to routers having one, that I'm left with few options for a lightweight file server in my house. Other than that, I am super impressed with the stability and speed I'm getting.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan E. G. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: My netgear router was flaking out so I replaced with with this eero. Very easy to set up and I liked it so much I've ordered another set up for our local business. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: W. Clark

customer_reviews.title: great improvement on our wifi signal
customer_reviews.text: I really fell in love with Eero from the get go. I now have them all over our house and it has improved our wifi greatly. they do run kind of hot and I tend to disconnect the ones we have in our summer home while we are not there but they are so easy to connect that they are a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: sariego

customer_reviews.title: Great mesh network
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it was to set up. Now my WiFi is very reliable and the signal finally reached my bed room . Great mesh network system. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: Eero lived up to my hopes/expectations. Since working at home became a necessity my xfinity extreme was having serious issues beyond the room with the modem. Tried various solutions. Tech visits. No luck. Before hardwiring ethernet throughout the house I decided to give Eero Pro with a couple of Beacons a try. The mesh network has increased my speed dramatically throughout the house. I'm very pleased with the product and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Maites

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup. Automatically programmed my all-in-one century link router. Easy to pause WiFi on any device linked to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jwkinsey

customer_reviews.title: Super easy fix for internet!
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure what product to use because all of them seem scary. I decided on this product and man did I choose well! This was so easy to install and we now have internet upstairs. I would highly recommend this product if you are having trouble receiving a signal anywhere in your house.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R

product_meta.title: Amazon eero Pro mesh WiFi system (1 Pro + 1 Beacon)
feature_bullets: Whole-home WiFi system - The Amazon eero Pro mesh WiFi system (1 eero Pro + 1 eero Beacon) replaces the traditional WiFi router, WiFi extender, and internet booster by covering a 1-2 bedroom home with fast and reliable internet powered by a mesh network.

eero 2nd generation - With the most intelligent mesh WiFi technology and powerful hardware, the eero 2nd generation WiFi system is 2x as fast as the original eero WiFi. Backwards compatible with 1st generation eeros.

WiFi extender - The eero Beacon is a full-fledged WiFi access point that simply plugs in to standard outlets and easily extends your WiFi connectivity to every device with more reliability than the standard WiFi booster.

Mesh network - Powered by proprietary TrueMesh technology, the eero mesh WiFi network leverages multiple wireless access points to create an incredibly dependable internet experience, all on a single mesh WiFi system.

Quick & easy setup - Replacing your old WiFi router has never been easier than with the eero Pro mesh WiFi system. Setup takes minutes and the companion mobile app makes managing your home WiFi simple and intuitive.
